00067 typedef struct _CameraFile CameraFile;
00068 
00069 int gp_file_new            (CameraFile **file);
00070 int gp_file_ref            (CameraFile *file);
00071 int gp_file_unref          (CameraFile *file);
00072 int gp_file_free           (CameraFile *file);
00073 
00074 /* "Do not use those"
00075  *
00076  * These functions probably were originally intended for internal use only.
00077  * However, due to
00078  *   - the lack of good documentation
00079  *   - this being the obvious way to save a file
00080  *   - the fact that libgphoto2 has been exporting all its internal
00081  *     symbols for years (until 2005-06)
00082  *   - our in-house frontends gphoto2 and gtkam using them
00083  * a number of external frontends started to use these functions, as
00084  * of 2005-06:
00085  *    - digikam
00086  *    - f-spot
00087  *    - gthumb
00088  * But a few frontends can live without it (and thus are likely to
00089  * use the correct API):
00090  *    - flphoto
00091  *    - kamera
00092  *
00093  * So we're going to phase these functions out over the next year or
00094  * so, going the GTK way of keeping the ABI but breaking the API. So
00095  * we'll continue to export functionally equivalent functions, but the
00096  * header files will not contain definitions for you to use any more.
00097  */
00098 int gp_file_open           (CameraFile *file, const char *filename);
00099 int gp_file_save           (CameraFile *file, const char *filename);
00100 int gp_file_clean          (CameraFile *file);
00101 int gp_file_copy           (CameraFile *destination, CameraFile *source);
00102 
00103 int gp_file_set_name       (CameraFile *file, const char  *name);
00104 int gp_file_get_name       (CameraFile *file, const char **name);
00105 
00106 int gp_file_set_mime_type  (CameraFile *file, const char  *mime_type);
00107 int gp_file_get_mime_type  (CameraFile *file, const char **mime_type);

00125 /* Conversion */
00126 
00127 /*
00128  * Please don't use the following in front-ends and camera drivers that are
00129  * not in gphoto CVS. We need to do some more work here, and this part of
00130  * the API is subject to change.
00131  *
00132  * If you like to do some work on conversion raw -> image/ *, please
00133  * step forward and write to gphoto-devel@lists.sourceforge.net.
00134  */
00135 typedef enum {
00136         GP_FILE_CONVERSION_METHOD_CHUCK
00137 } CameraFileConversionMethod;
